## replaceCurrentRouteWithShallowRoute() function

\[Replace\] the current route with a \[shallow route\].

**Signature:**

```typescript
replaceCurrentRouteWithShallowRoute: ({ router, }: {
    router: NextRouter;
}) => Promise<boolean>
```

</td><td>

</td><td>


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;boolean&gt;

## Remarks

This is useful to set the replace this initial route of shallow-routed pages (e.g. index pages with custom shallow routing logic) with a shallow route.

Without this change if the user uses the back button/gesture to return to the initial route of a page driven by shallow routing Next.js will do an unnecessary full page load (running getServerSideProps and displaying the global loading indicator rather than the page-specific loading indicator). This isn’t inherently a problem but it’s a confusing user experience.

Ideally Next.js add more sophisticated routing capabilities to remove the need for workarounds like this.

\[replace\]: https://nextjs.org/docs/api-reference/next/router\#routerreplace \[shallow route\]: https://nextjs.org/docs/routing/shallow-routing
